Reason: The configuration option _journalDiskSync is performance-sensitive. This is because the _journalDiskSync configuration directly affects the system performance at the system level by determining the synchronization behavior of disk operations within the PersistentJournal. Therefore, the configuration is considered performance-sensitive based on the presence of time-extensive and memory-extensive operations within its related code.
